intro: Latrobea diosmifolia var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous leafed latrobea, is a rare and unique species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, which are usually pale green to white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
